modName: Skyrim Savegame Utilities - For Skyrim Potion Maker
summary: Skyrim Savegame Utilities is the PC program I made to support my Android app Skyrim Potion Maker.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#FF1515][size=4]Skyrim Savegame Utilities[/size][/color]

This is a PC program that offers three functions. Here is a brief description of each. A fuller description is contained within the help files contained in the program.

[color=#FF1515]Savegame Savior[/color] - This function monitors your savegame directory and renames the quicksaves (ess and skse files) when they are created by the game. You can set how many renamed files it will keep.

[color=#FF1515]PC Sync XML[/color] - This function allows you import and export the XML files used by the Android app [b]Skyrim Potion Maker[/b].

[color=#FF1515]Potion Maker Options[/color] - This function works while you play Skyrim. It reads your latest savegame, extracts your current alchemy information (known ingredients and their effects) and makes the information available to the Android app [b]Skyrim Potion Maker[/b]. From the Android app, you request this information when you are ready to make potion recipes.

Link to the Android App Skyrim Potion Maker on Google Play store: [url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.rick.android_skyrimpotionmaker]Skyrim Potion Maker[/url]

[color=#FF1515][size=4]Installation[/size][/color]

There are two versions of the PC program you can download and install:

[b]Lite Version[/b] - This one requires that you have the latest Java Runtime installed on your computer (minimum 7.45). You can get the latest Java [url=http://www.java.com/en/]here[/url].

[b]Full Version[/b] - This one contains all of the required Java Runtime libraries. Download this one if you don't want to install the latest Java Runtime on your computer.

This program does not have a windows installer. Once you download one of the zip files, extract it to a location on your hard drive. Within the root directory [b]SkyrimUtilities[/b] is the program [b]SkyrimUtilities.exe[/b]. This is the one you will need to run.

Create a shortcut on your desktop: right-click the [b]SkyrimUtilities.exe[/b] file in Wndows Explorer and select [i]Send to -> Desktop (create shortcut[/i]. Once it is on the desktop, it will show the default Java coffee cup icon. Right-click the icon and select {i]Properties[/i], select the [i]Shortcut[/i] panel, and click the [b]Change Icon...[/b] button. Click the [b]Browse[/b] button and select the [b]SkyrimUtilities.ico[/b] file.

[color=#FF1515][size=4]Uninstall[/size][/color]

To uninstall just delete the desktop icon and the [b]SkyrimUtilities[/b] directory.

[color=#FF1515][size=4]Source Code[/size][/color]

The source code is available on GitHub here: [url=https://github.com/Rick-A-Droid/SkyrimSaveGameUtilities]SkyrimSaveGameUtilities[/url].

[color=#FF1515][size=4]Credits[/size][/color]

Thank you fellow Nexus member [b]trira[/b], for supplying the code to parse the savegame file and extract the alchemy information.
author: GamerRick
